isis.stitle: Lucas Varity/TRW Hydraulic Antilock Brake System - MAINTENANCE - SOFT PEDAL OR EXCESSIVE PEDAL TRAVEL

svcproc.title: SOFT PEDAL OR EXCESSIVE PEDAL TRAVEL
svcproc.para: Soft pedal or excessive pedal travel may be the result of a leaking master cylinder, wheel cylinder, or defective HCU. The following steps will assist in determining if the HCU is the cause:

step1.para:
Remove the rubber boots from the 4 HCU low pressure accumulators
.

note.para: One of the accumulator ports is blocked by the EHCU bracket. It may not be possible to perform this test on the blocked port.

step1.para: Insert a clean steel probe into each low pressure accumulator.

Have an assistant press hard and quickly on the brake pedal while watching for travel of the probe. If there is any travel of the probe, the HCU will need to be replaced. If there is not any travel of the probe, the master cylinder or wheel cylinders may be faulty.
